conclusion: There are four objects (A, B, C, D) casting shadows on the ground.
The current position of the light source creates specific shadow sizes and positions.
Moving the light source forward means it will be closer to the objects.
Shadows will shift slightly backward as the light source moves forward due to the change in the angle of light.
Shadows will increase in size because the light source being closer to the objects makes the angle of light more acute.
The shadows A, B, C, and D will shift backward and become larger.
